snippet: Mr. Pataki, one of the 17 Republican contenders, spends a lot of time reminding people that he used to be governor of New York.
abstract: Former New York Gov George E Pataki, who has been out of public office for nearly decade, struggles to remind voters of who he is as he campaigns for Republican presidential nomination; is unusual among candidates in race that has focused on novelty and spectacle and has set himself apart by criticizing opponents for their increasingly right-wing positions on issues such as immigration, vaccination policies and abortion.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Pataki, one of the 17 Republican contenders, spends a lot of time reminding people that he used to be governor of New York.

headline.main: George Pataki, in Presidential Bid, Fights to Jog Voters’ Memories
headline.print_headline: Pataki Fighting to Jog Voters’ Memories as He Campaigns for President
